org.fxmisc.easybind.monadic

Interface MonadicObservableValue<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Superinterfaces:
    javafx.beans.Observable, javafx.beans.value.ObservableObjectValue<T>, javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MonadicBinding<T>, PropertyBinding<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PreboundBinding

    public interface MonadicObservableValue<T>
extends javafx.beans.value.ObservableObjectValue<T>
    Adds monadic operations to ObservableValue.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default MonadicBinding<T> filter(java.util.function.Predicate<? super T> p)
      Returns a new ObservableValue that holds the same value as this ObservableValue when the value satisfies the predicate and is empty when this ObservableValue is empty or its value does not satisfy the given predicate.
      default <U> MonadicBinding<U> flatMap(java.util.function.Function<? super T,javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<U>> f)
      Returns a new ObservableValue that, when this ObservableValue holds value x, holds the value held by f(x), and is empty when this ObservableValue is empty.
      default java.util.Optional<T> getOpt()
      Returns an Optional describing the value currently held by this ObservableValue, or and empty Optional if this ObservableValue is empty.
      default T getOrElse(T other)
      Returns the value currently held by this ObservableValue.
      default T getOrThrow()
      Returns the value currently held by this ObservableValue.
      default void ifPresent(java.util.function.Consumer<? super T> f)
      Invokes the given function if this ObservableValue holds a (non-null) value.
      default boolean isEmpty()
      Inverse of isPresent().
      default boolean isPresent()
      Checks whether this ObservableValue holds a (non-null) value.
      default <U> MonadicBinding<U> map(java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends U> f)
      Returns a new ObservableValue that holds a mapping of the value held by this ObservableValue, and is empty when this ObservableValue is empty.
      default MonadicBinding<T> orElse(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<T> other)
      Returns a new ObservableValue that holds the value held by this ObservableValue, or the value held by other when this ObservableValue is empty.
      default MonadicBinding<T> orElse(T other)
      Returns a new ObservableValue that holds the value held by this ObservableValue, or other when this ObservableValue is empty.
      default <U> SelectBuilder<U> select(java.util.function.Function<? super T,javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<U>> selector)
      Starts a selection chain.
      default <U> PropertyBinding<U> selectProperty(java.util.function.Function<? super T,javafx.beans.property.Property<U>> f)
      Similar to flatMap(Function), except the returned Binding is also a Property.
      default Subscription subscribe(javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<? super T> listener)
      Adds a change listener and returns a Subscription that can be used to remove that listener.
      default Subscription subscribe(javafx.beans.InvalidationListener listener)
      Adds an invalidation listener and returns a Subscription that can be used to remove that listener.

      • ifPresent

        default void ifPresent(java.util.function.Consumer<? super T> f)
        Invokes the given function if this ObservableValue holds a (non-null) value.
        Parameters:
        f - function to invoke on the value currently held by this ObservableValue.

      • getOrThrow

        default T getOrThrow()
        Returns the value currently held by this ObservableValue.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there is no value present.

      • getOrElse

        default T getOrElse(T other)
        Returns the value currently held by this ObservableValue. If this ObservableValue is empty, other is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        other - value to return if there is no value present in this ObservableValue.

      • getOpt

        default java.util.Optional<T> getOpt()
        Returns an Optional describing the value currently held by this ObservableValue, or and empty Optional if this ObservableValue is empty.

      • orElse

        default MonadicBinding<T> orElse(T other)
        Returns a new ObservableValue that holds the value held by this ObservableValue, or other when this ObservableValue is empty.

      • orElse

        default MonadicBinding<T> orElse(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<T> other)
        Returns a new ObservableValue that holds the value held by this ObservableValue, or the value held by other when this ObservableValue is empty.

      • filter

        default MonadicBinding<T> filter(java.util.function.Predicate<? super T> p)
        Returns a new ObservableValue that holds the same value as this ObservableValue when the value satisfies the predicate and is empty when this ObservableValue is empty or its value does not satisfy the given predicate.
        Parameters:
        p -

      • map

        default <U> MonadicBinding<U> map(java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends U> f)
        Returns a new ObservableValue that holds a mapping of the value held by this ObservableValue, and is empty when this ObservableValue is empty.
        Parameters:
        f - function to map the value held by this ObservableValue.

      • flatMap

        default <U> MonadicBinding<U> flatMap(java.util.function.Function<? super T,javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<U>> f)
        Returns a new ObservableValue that, when this ObservableValue holds value x, holds the value held by f(x), and is empty when this ObservableValue is empty.
        Parameters:
        f -

      • selectProperty

        default <U> PropertyBinding<U> selectProperty(java.util.function.Function<? super T,javafx.beans.property.Property<U>> f)
        Similar to flatMap(Function), except the returned Binding is also a Property. This means you can call setValue() and bind() methods on the returned value, which delegate to the currently selected Property.

        As the value of this ObservableValue changes, so does the selected Property. When the Property returned from this method is bound, as the selected Property changes, the previously selected property is unbound and the newly selected property is bound.

        Note that if the currently selected property is null, then calling getValue() on the returned value will return null regardless of any prior call to setValue() or bind().

        Note that you need to retain a reference to the returned value to prevent it from being garbage collected.

      • select

        default <U> SelectBuilder<U> select(java.util.function.Function<? super T,javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<U>> selector)
        Starts a selection chain. A selection chain is just a more efficient equivalent to a chain of flatMaps.
        Parameters:
        selector -
        Returns:

      • subscribe

        default Subscription subscribe(javafx.beans.InvalidationListener listener)
        Adds an invalidation listener and returns a Subscription that can be used to remove that listener. 
         
 Subscription s = observable.subscribe(obs -> doSomething());

 // later
 s.unsubscribe();
        is equivalent to 
         
 InvalidationListener l = obs -> doSomething();
 observable.addListener(l);

 // later
 observable.removeListener();
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • subscribe

        default Subscription subscribe(javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<? super T> listener)
        Adds a change listener and returns a Subscription that can be used to remove that listener. See the example at subscribe(InvalidationListener).
        Parameters:
        listener -
